Type.Name: ObsoleteAttribute

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable ObsoleteAttribute extends System.Attribute

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.Class | System.AttributeTargets.Struct | System.AttributeTargets.Enum | System.AttributeTargets.Constructor | System.AttributeTargets.Method | System.AttributeTargets.Property | System.AttributeTargets.Field | System.AttributeTargets.Event | System.AttributeTargets.Interface | System.AttributeTargets.Delegate | System.AttributeTargets.All, Inherited=false)

summary.para: Indicates that the target of the current attribute will be removed in future versions of the assembly in which the target is contained.

block.para: Marking an item as obsolete provides consumers of that item the information that the item will be not be available in future versions of the assembly in which it is contained. A has a property that can be used to suggest alternative ways of obtaining the functionality provided by the item, i.e. a workaround. This class also has a property that designates whether a compiler will treat usage of the obsolete item as an error. If this property is , the compiler will issue a warning if the obsolete item is used and the compiler supports the generation of such warnings.
This attribute can be applied to any valid attribute target except assemblies, parameters, and return values. For a complete list of valid attribute targets, see .

example.para: The following example demonstrates the usage of to generate a compile-time warning.

para.c: ObsoleteAttributeExample.cs(8,4): warning CS0618: 'ObsoleteAttributeExample.OldMethod()' is obsolete: 'OldMethod is being removed: use NewMethod in future versions.'

summary.para: Gets a that contains suggested workarounds for the target of the current instance.

value.para: A that contains suggested workarounds for the target of the current instance.

remarks.para: The current instance contains a suggested workaround message if and only if such a message was specified when the current instance was constructed. If no workaround was specified for the current instance, the value of this property is .
